modules.description: Provides functions to generate and manipulate sampled curves using Gg.p2 points. Operates on functions mapping floats to points, lists of points, and sequences of points. Used to create uniform samples of parametric curves, convert between lists and sequences, and handle piecewise curves with cuts.

Provides functions for adaptive sampling of parametric and implicit curves, including root-finding and interval refinement. Operates on numerical intervals, function closures, and point lists representing curve segments. Used to generate accurate polygonal approximations for rendering or numerical analysis tasks.

Generates and manipulates sampled 2D curves using Gg.p2 points, supporting functions that map floats to points, lists of points, and point sequences. Enables uniform sampling of parametric curves, conversion between list and sequence representations, and handling of piecewise curves with defined cuts. Operations include curve segmentation, point interpolation, and transformation between data structures. Example tasks include sampling a sine wave, splitting a curve at specified intervals, and converting a list of points into a lazy sequence.
